_params.toChainID.merge_dataflows: function routerCallNative(BaseCrossChainParams calldata _params, bytes calldata _data) external payable nonReentrant whenNotPaused { if (!availableRouters.contains(_params.router)) { revert RouterNotAvailable(); } IntegratorFeeInfo memory _info = integratorToFeeInfo[_params.integrator]; uint256 _amountIn = accrueTokenFees(_params.integrator, _info, accrueFixedCryptoFee(_params.integrator, _info), 0, address(0)); AddressUpgradeable.functionCallWithValue(_params.router, _data, _amountIn); emit RequestSent(_params); } function functionCallWithValue(address target, bytes memory data, uint256 value) internal returns (bytes memory) { return functionCallWithValue(target, data, value, "Address: low-level call with value failed"); } function isContract(address account) internal view returns (bool) { return account.code.length > 0; } function verifyCallResult(bool success, bytes memory returndata, string memory errorMessage) internal pure returns (bytes memory) { if (success) { return returndata; } else { if (returndata.length > 0) { assembly { let returndata_size := mload(returndata) revert(add(32, returndata), returndata_size) } } else { revert(errorMessage); } } }

result.reason: The function call to an external router can lead to reentrancy vulnerabilities, especially in cross-chain contexts where the called contract may not be properly controlled or verified. If the external router is malicious or compromised, it could execute arbitrary code, leading to unintended behavior.

The check for availability of routers could be manipulated if the list `availableRouters` is not properly controlled. An attacker could potentially replace the router with a malicious contract if proper access controls are not implemented, leading to execution of harmful actions across chains.

The logic around fee accrual may be compromised especially in cross-chain scenarios where different standards may apply to fee structures on different chains. If a user can manipulate the input parameters, they could affect the fees paid or received, enabling exploitation.
